{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Klenow fragment is a large protein fragment produced when DNA Polymerase I from E. coli is cleaved by the protease subtilisin. It retains the 5'-3' polymerase activity and the 3'-5' exonuclease proofreading activity of the original enzyme, but it lacks the 5'-3' exonuclease activity.", "answer_choice": "B. 5'-3' exonuclease"}
